info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 2:43PM CDT until July 19 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following counties, Lake IN and Porter.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated torrential rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hammond, Gary, Portage, Merrillville, Valparaiso, Schererville, Hobart, Crown Point, Highland, Munster, Chesterton, Griffith, Dyer, St. John, Lake Station, South Haven, Porter, New Chicago, Burns Harbor and Ogden Dunes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
